intro: Orthanthera browniana, commonly known as the Brown's orthanthera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to lavender. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Orthanthera browniana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
